Tucson looks back to Vestige, as he slowly backs himself onto the other end=
 of the catapult.  He quickly turns back to the insects and positions himse=
lf to prepare for flight.  He wastes no time in giving the signal to implem=
ent his attempt to go airbourne.

" NOW!"  


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com=
, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson nod=
ds to Vestige, and suddenly comes up with an idea. He still could move swif=
tly and dexterously, thanks to his ninjabot training. If ever a time where =
it was needed it was now. He looks around quickly and notices that a format=
ion of old metal debris lying on rubble resembles a teeter toter lever. whi=
ch he knew he could use as a vaulting platform. It would just take a second=
 individual to step on the other end to send him upward for his maneuver. H=
e points to it.
> >
> > " See that? It resembles a catapoult lever. One ind=
ividual stands on one end, while the other jumps on the other end to send t=
he first individual airbourne. From there, I'm sure I can make it to the be=
d. It's an old Ninjabot trick I learned during training. And if I play my c=
ards right, it'll be a maneuver they don't see comming."
> >
> > With that =
he draws his sword, keeping an eye on the insects.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Vestige =
nodded as he glanced at the piece of metal that lay on the
> floor and then=
 back at Tuscon. The piece of metal was actually armor
> plating that had b=
een part of the wall before the fire fight had
> started. Now it lay discar=
ded on the floor, laying haphazardly on top
> of debris, ready for Tuscon a=
nd Vestige's use.
> 
> "I see." Vestige said said, his optics clear and foc=
used. Turning he
> launched a few more shots on the approaching insectoids,=
 thier armor
> absorbing the brunt of his attacks, but even now begining to=
 burn and
> scorch. However Vestige took the moment to get into position.
>=
 
> The insects approach Tuscon warily, thier multifaceted optics looking
>=
 at his sword, thier tail mounted cannons oriented on it and him.
> 
> "You=
 cannot succeed Autobot!" Says the voice of the insecoids, "We are
> the ho=
ard, surrender now."
> 
> The insectoids quickly begin to close on Tuscon's=
 position, thier
> cannons peppering the area around him with firepower and=
 explosive
> ordanaces!
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
